dmca.title: Re: Illegal and pirated information being hosted on your servers. http://www.helbreat
dmca.body:
----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Legal Response 
  To: tbryan@ient.com 
  Cc: Theplanet@chillingeffects.org 
  Sent: Tuesday, December 12, 2006 3:43 AM
  Subject: FW: Illegal and pirated information being hosted on your servers.
http://www.helbreathnemesis.com/


  To Whom It May Concern:

   

  Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

   

  Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

   

  Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright.

   

  Legal Response Team

  THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.




------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  From: Tamara Bryan, Helbreath USA [mailto:tbryan@ient.com] 
  Sent: Saturday, December 09, 2006 7:41 PM
  To: Legal Response
  Subject: Illegal and pirated information being hosted on your servers.
http://www.helbreathnemesis.com/
  Importance: High


  Hello,

   

  I am Tamara Bryan, Gamemaster of HelbreathUSA http://www.helbreathusa.com .  I am
contacting you in regards to the web site http://www.helbreathnemesis.com/

   

  The official game site of the developer is located at http://www.helbreath.com and
legally licensed by http://www.helbreathusa.com.  This web site is hosting
information and files advertising and how to connect to their illegal server.  We,
iENT, are authorized by the copyright owner, Siementech, to seek out and close
illegal servers.

   

  Their actions include copyright infringement and software piracy related material.
 The source code for this game was illegally leaked to the public, and altered by
those not authorized by the copyright holder.

   

  The participants are violating the copyright agreement as your servers are being
used in an illegal fashion. Please take care of this abuse of our copyright and
your Terms of Service by removing this website.

   

  The user has blocked my IP from being able to view the web site, given that they
know that I'm writing to the company that hosts the site. They've also stated that
IEntertainment should stop emailing their service providers "or else" they'll
release the source code publicly. I've had to go to a different location in order
to view the site, and have others provide me with information from it. Please
advise me of exactly what action has been taken so that I can advise the copyright
owner and get that information back to you with what's needed.  

   

  Thank you for your prompt action in this matter.

   

  Sincerely, 

   

  Tamara Bryan

  Game Master Helbreath USA

Notification of Claimed Copyright Infringement
(Digital Millennium Copyright Act, 17 U.S.C.
